frame.name: Scrutiny
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame concerns a <fen>Cognizer</fen> (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the <fen>Ground</fen>, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics. The <fen>Cognizer</fen> may be interested in a particular characteristic or entity, the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>, that belongs to the <fen>Ground</fen> or is contained in the <fen>Ground</fen> (or to ensure that such a property of entity is not present). Some words in this frame allow alternate expressions of the <fen>Ground</fen>and the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>: <ex>We <t>searched</t> <fex name="Ground">the yard</fex> <fex name="Phen"> for my contact lens</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The FE is normally expressed as an External Argument: <ex><fex name="Cognizer">Leslie</fex> <t>examined</t> the glass for cracks.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This FE can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement. <ex>Leslie <t>examined</t> <fex name="Ground">the glass</fex> for cracks.</ex> <ex>Kim <t>searched</t> <fex name="Ground">the woods</fex> for mushrooms.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Phenomenon
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Phenomenon</fen> identifies the property that belongs to an entity or that the entity contains. Typically, it is expressed as a <ment>for</ment>-PP. <ex>Leslie <t>examined</t> the glass <fex name="Phenomenon">for cracks</fex>.</ex> <ex>Kim <t>searched</t> the woods <fex name="Phenomenon">for mushrooms</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> scrutinizes the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to scrutinize the <fen>Ground</fen>. <ex>We <t>analysed</t> the sediment <fex name="Mns">by putting it through the mass spec</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> scrutinizes the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Direction</fen> is used for all path-like expressions, except those indicating the location of the perceiver, that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception. <ex>The detective <t>looked</t> <fex name="Direction">across the street</fex> at the suspect.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>Some of the words in this frame occur with a constituent that expresses the desired outcome of the Scrutiny. Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by <ment>for</ment> or a <ment>to</ment>-marked VP Complement.
<ex>You should <t>inspect</t> your mail <fex name="Purp">to determine the outcome of the module transfer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The FE is normally expressed as an External Argument: <ex><fex name="Medium">Chapter four</fex> <t>examined</t> the case for free speech.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
<ex>The temperature controller <t>monitored</t> the temperature <fex name="ins">with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.</ex></def-root>
